intro: Silene araratica subsp. araratica, commonly known as the mountain pink, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States. It is characterized by its rosette of fleshy, blue-green leaves and clusters of showy pink or purple flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. It is part of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological traits. Silene araratica subsp. araratica is often found in alpine meadows and is an important component of its ecological community.
